00160         { BRW_WRITE_BYTES,      "write_bytes" },
00161 };
00162 
00163 const char *ll_opcode2str(__u32 opcode)
00164 {
00165         /* When one of the assertions below fail, chances are that:
00166          *     1) A new opcode was added in include/lustre/lustre_idl.h,
00167          *        but is missing from the table above.
00168          * or  2) The opcode space was renumbered or rearranged,
00169          *        and the opcode_offset() function in
00170          *        ptlrpc_internal.h needs to be modified.
00171          */
00172         __u32 offset = opcode_offset(opcode);
00173         LASSERTF(offset < LUSTRE_MAX_OPCODES,
00174                  "offset %u >= LUSTRE_MAX_OPCODES %u\n",
00175                  offset, LUSTRE_MAX_OPCODES);
00176         LASSERTF(ll_rpc_opcode_table[offset].opcode == opcode,
00177                  "ll_rpc_opcode_table[%u].opcode %u != opcode %u\n",
00178                  offset, ll_rpc_opcode_table[offset].opcode, opcode);
00179         return ll_rpc_opcode_table[offset].opname;
00180 }
00181 
00182 static const char *ll_eopcode2str(__u32 opcode)
00183 {
00184         LASSERT(ll_eopcode_table[opcode].opcode == opcode);
00185         return ll_eopcode_table[opcode].opname;
00186 }
00187 
00188 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00189 static void ptlrpc_lprocfs_register(struct proc_dir_entry *root, char *dir,
00190                              char *name, struct proc_dir_entry **procroot_ret,
00191                              struct lprocfs_stats **stats_ret)
00192 {
00193         struct proc_dir_entry *svc_procroot;
00194         struct lprocfs_stats *svc_stats;
00195         int i, rc;
00196         unsigned int svc_counter_config = LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX |
00197                                           LPROCFS_CNTR_STDDEV;
00198 
00199         LASSERT(*procroot_ret == NULL);
00200         LASSERT(*stats_ret == NULL);
00201 
00202         svc_stats = lprocfs_alloc_stats(EXTRA_MAX_OPCODES+LUSTRE_MAX_OPCODES,0);
00203         if (svc_stats == NULL)
00204                 return;
00205 
00206         if (dir) {
00207                 svc_procroot = lprocfs_register(dir, root, NULL, NULL);
00208                 if (IS_ERR(svc_procroot)) {
00209                         lprocfs_free_stats(&svc_stats);
00210                         return;
00211                 }
00212         } else {
00213                 svc_procroot = root;
00214         }
00215 
00216         lprocfs_counter_init(svc_stats, PTLRPC_REQWAIT_CNTR,
00217                              svc_counter_config, "req_waittime", "usec");
00218         lprocfs_counter_init(svc_stats, PTLRPC_REQQDEPTH_CNTR,
00219                              svc_counter_config, "req_qdepth", "reqs");
00220         lprocfs_counter_init(svc_stats, PTLRPC_REQACTIVE_CNTR,
00221                              svc_counter_config, "req_active", "reqs");
00222         lprocfs_counter_init(svc_stats, PTLRPC_TIMEOUT,
00223                              svc_counter_config, "req_timeout", "sec");
00224         lprocfs_counter_init(svc_stats, PTLRPC_REQBUF_AVAIL_CNTR,
00225                              svc_counter_config, "reqbuf_avail", "bufs");
00226         for (i = 0; i < EXTRA_LAST_OPC; i++) {
00227                 char *units;
00228 
00229                 switch(i) {
00230                 case BRW_WRITE_BYTES:
00231                 case BRW_READ_BYTES:
00232                         units = "bytes";
00233                         break;
00234                 default:
00235                         units = "reqs";
00236                         break;
00237                 }
00238                 lprocfs_counter_init(svc_stats, PTLRPC_LAST_CNTR + i,
00239                                      svc_counter_config,
00240                                      ll_eopcode2str(i), units);
00241         }
00242         for (i = 0; i < LUSTRE_MAX_OPCODES; i++) {
00243                 __u32 opcode = ll_rpc_opcode_table[i].opcode;
00244                 lprocfs_counter_init(svc_stats,
00245                                      EXTRA_MAX_OPCODES + i, svc_counter_config,
00246                                      ll_opcode2str(opcode), "usec");
00247         }
00248 
00249         rc = lprocfs_register_stats(svc_procroot, name, svc_stats);
00250         if (rc < 0) {
00251                 if (dir)
00252                         lprocfs_remove(&svc_procroot);
00253                 lprocfs_free_stats(&svc_stats);
00254         } else {
00255                 if (dir)
00256                         *procroot_ret = svc_procroot;
00257                 *stats_ret = svc_stats;
00258         }
00259 }
00260 
00261 static int
00262 ptlrpc_lprocfs_req_history_len_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00263 {
00264         struct ptlrpc_service *svc = m->private;
00265         struct ptlrpc_service_part *svcpt;
00266         int     total = 0;
00267         int     i;
00268 
00269         ptlrpc_service_for_each_part(svcpt, i, svc)
00270                 total += svcpt->scp_hist_nrqbds;
00271 
00272         seq_printf(m, "%d\n", total);
00273         return 0;
00274 }
00275 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RO(ptlrpc_lprocfs_req_history_len);
00276 
00277 static int
00278 ptlrpc_lprocfs_req_history_max_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *n)
00279 {
00280         struct ptlrpc_service *svc = m->private;
00281         struct ptlrpc_service_part *svcpt;
00282         int     total = 0;
00283         int     i;
00284 
00285         ptlrpc_service_for_each_part(svcpt, i, svc)
00286                 total += svc->srv_hist_nrqbds_cpt_max;
00287 
00288         seq_printf(m, "%d\n", total);
00289         return 0;
00290 }
00291 
00292 static ssize_t
00293 ptlrpc_lprocfs_req_history_max_seq_write(struct file *file,
00294                                          const char __user *buffer,
00295                                          size_t count, loff_t *off)
00296 {
00297         struct seq_file *m = file->private_data;
00298         struct ptlrpc_service *svc = m->private;
00299         int bufpages;
00300         __s64 val;
00301         int rc;
00302 
00303         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00304         if (rc < 0)
00305                 return rc;
00306 
00307         if (val < 0 || val > INT_MAX)
00308                 return -ERANGE;
00309 
00310         /* This sanity check is more of an insanity check; we can still
00311          * hose a kernel by allowing the request history to grow too
00312          * far. */
00313         bufpages = (svc->srv_buf_size + PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - 1) >>
00314                                                         PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00315         if (val > totalram_pages/(2 * bufpages))
00316                 return -ERANGE;
00317 
00318         spin_lock(&svc->srv_lock);
00319 
00320         if (val == 0)
00321                 svc->srv_hist_nrqbds_cpt_max = 0;
00322         else
00323                 svc->srv_hist_nrqbds_cpt_max =
00324                         max(1, ((int)val / svc->srv_ncpts));
00325 
00326         spin_unlock(&svc->srv_lock);
00327 
00328         return count;
00329 }
00330 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(ptlrpc_lprocfs_req_history_max);
00331 
00332 static int
00333 ptlrpc_lprocfs_threads_min_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *n)
00334 {
00335         struct ptlrpc_service *svc = m->private;
00336 
00337         seq_printf(m, "%d\n",
00338                    svc->srv_nthrs_cpt_init * svc->srv_ncpts);
00339         return 0;
00340 }
00341 
00342 static ssize_t
00343 ptlrpc_lprocfs_threads_min_seq_write(struct file *file,
00344                                      const char __user *buffer,
00345                                      size_t count, loff_t *off)
00346 {
00347         struct seq_file *m = file->private_data;
00348         struct ptlrpc_service *svc = m->private;
00349         __s64 val;
00350         int rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00351 
00352         if (rc < 0)
00353                 return rc;
00354 
00355         if (val / svc->srv_ncpts < PTLRPC_NTHRS_INIT)
00356                 return -ERANGE;
00357 
00358         spin_lock(&svc->srv_lock);
00359         if (val > svc->srv_nthrs_cpt_limit * svc->srv_ncpts) {
00360                 spin_unlock(&svc->srv_lock);
00361                 return -ERANGE;
00362         }
00363 
00364         svc->srv_nthrs_cpt_init = (int)val / svc->srv_ncpts;
00365 
00366         spin_unlock(&svc->srv_lock);
00367 
00368         return count;
00369 }
00370 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(ptlrpc_lprocfs_threads_min);
00371 
00372 static int
00373 ptlrpc_lprocfs_threads_started_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *n)
00374 {
00375         struct ptlrpc_service           *svc = m->private;
00376         struct ptlrpc_service_part      *svcpt;
00377         int     total = 0;
00378         int     i;
00379 
00380         ptlrpc_service_for_each_part(svcpt, i, svc)
00381                 total += svcpt->scp_nthrs_running;
00382 
00383         seq_printf(m, "%d\n", total);
00384         return 0;
00385 }
00386 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RO(ptlrpc_lprocfs_threads_started);

00388 static int
00389 ptlrpc_lprocfs_threads_max_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *n)
00390 {
00391         struct ptlrpc_service *svc = m->private;
00392 
00393         seq_printf(m, "%d\n",
00394                    svc->srv_nthrs_cpt_limit * svc->srv_ncpts);
00395         return 0;
00396 }
00397 
00398 static ssize_t
00399 ptlrpc_lprocfs_threads_max_seq_write(struct file *file,
00400                                      const char __user *buffer,
00401                                      size_t count, loff_t *off)
00402 {
00403         struct seq_file *m = file->private_data;
00404         struct ptlrpc_service *svc = m->private;
00405         __s64 val;
00406         int rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00407 
00408         if (rc < 0)
00409                 return rc;
00410 
00411         if (val / svc->srv_ncpts < PTLRPC_NTHRS_INIT)
00412                 return -ERANGE;
00413 
00414         spin_lock(&svc->srv_lock);
00415         if (val < svc->srv_nthrs_cpt_init * svc->srv_ncpts) {
00416                 spin_unlock(&svc->srv_lock);
00417                 return -ERANGE;
00418         }
00419 
00420         svc->srv_nthrs_cpt_limit = (int)val / svc->srv_ncpts;
00421 
00422         spin_unlock(&svc->srv_lock);
00423 
00424         return count;
00425 }
00426 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(ptlrpc_lprocfs_threads_max);
00427 
00433 static const char *nrs_state2str(enum ptlrpc_nrs_pol_state state)
00434 {
00435         switch (state) {
00436         default:
00437                 LBUG();
00438         case NRS_POL_STATE_INVALID:
00439                 return "invalid";
00440         case NRS_POL_STATE_STOPPED:
00441                 return "stopped";
00442         case NRS_POL_STATE_STOPPING:
00443                 return "stopping";
00444         case NRS_POL_STATE_STARTING:
00445                 return "starting";
00446         case NRS_POL_STATE_STARTED:
00447                 return "started";
00448         }
00449 }
00450 
00459 void nrs_policy_get_info_locked(struct ptlrpc_nrs_policy *policy,
00460                                 struct ptlrpc_nrs_pol_info *info)
00461 {
00462         LASSERT(policy != NULL);
00463         LASSERT(info != NULL);
00464         assert_spin_locked(&policy->pol_nrs->nrs_lock);
00465 
00466         LASSERT(sizeof(info->pi_arg) == sizeof(policy->pol_arg));
00467         memcpy(info->pi_name, policy->pol_desc->pd_name, NRS_POL_NAME_MAX);
00468         memcpy(info->pi_arg, policy->pol_arg, sizeof(policy->pol_arg));
00469 
00470         info->pi_fallback    = !!(policy->pol_flags & PTLRPC_NRS_FL_FALLBACK);
00471         info->pi_state       = policy->pol_state;
00476         info->pi_req_queued  = policy->pol_req_queued;
00477         info->pi_req_started = policy->pol_req_started;
00478 }
00479 
00484 static int ptlrpc_lprocfs_nrs_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *n)
00485 {
00486         struct ptlrpc_service          *svc = m->private;
00487         struct ptlrpc_service_part     *svcpt;
00488         struct ptlrpc_nrs              *nrs;
00489         struct ptlrpc_nrs_policy       *policy;
00490         struct ptlrpc_nrs_pol_info     *infos;
00491         struct ptlrpc_nrs_pol_info      tmp;
00492         unsigned                        num_pols;
00493         unsigned                        pol_idx = 0;
00494         bool                            hp = false;
00495         int                             i;
00496         int                             rc = 0;
00497         ENTRY;
00498 
00503         mutex_lock(&nrs_core.nrs_mutex);
00504 
00510         nrs = nrs_svcpt2nrs(svc->srv_parts[0], false);
00511 
00512         spin_lock(&nrs->nrs_lock);
00513         num_pols = svc->srv_parts[0]->scp_nrs_reg.nrs_num_pols;
00514         spin_unlock(&nrs->nrs_lock);
00515 
00516         OBD_ALLOC(infos, num_pols * sizeof(*infos));
00517         if (infos == NULL)
00518                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00519 again:
00520 
00521         ptlrpc_service_for_each_part(svcpt, i, svc) {
00522                 nrs = nrs_svcpt2nrs(svcpt, hp);
00523                 spin_lock(&nrs->nrs_lock);
00524 
00525                 pol_idx = 0;
00526 
00527                 list_for_each_entry(policy, &nrs->nrs_policy_list,
00528                                     pol_list) {
00529                         LASSERT(pol_idx < num_pols);
00530 
00531                         nrs_policy_get_info_locked(policy, &tmp);
00536                         if (i == 0) {
00537                                 memcpy(infos[pol_idx].pi_name, tmp.pi_name,
00538                                        NRS_POL_NAME_MAX);
00539                                 memcpy(infos[pol_idx].pi_arg, tmp.pi_arg,
00540                                        sizeof(tmp.pi_arg));
00541                                 memcpy(&infos[pol_idx].pi_state, &tmp.pi_state,
00542                                        sizeof(tmp.pi_state));
00543                                 infos[pol_idx].pi_fallback = tmp.pi_fallback;
00548                         } else {
00549                                 LASSERT(strncmp(infos[pol_idx].pi_name,
00550                                                 tmp.pi_name,
00551                                                 NRS_POL_NAME_MAX) == 0);
00552                                 LASSERT(strncmp(infos[pol_idx].pi_arg,
00553                                                 tmp.pi_arg,
00554                                                 sizeof(tmp.pi_arg)) == 0);
00561                                 LASSERT(infos[pol_idx].pi_fallback ==
00562                                         tmp.pi_fallback);
00563                         }
00564 
00565                         infos[pol_idx].pi_req_queued += tmp.pi_req_queued;
00566                         infos[pol_idx].pi_req_started += tmp.pi_req_started;
00567 
00568                         pol_idx++;
00569                 }
00570                 spin_unlock(&nrs->nrs_lock);
00571         }
00572 
00603         seq_printf(m, "%s\n", !hp ? "\nregular_requests:" :
00604                    "high_priority_requests:");
00605 
00606         for (pol_idx = 0; pol_idx < num_pols; pol_idx++) {
00607                 if (strlen(infos[pol_idx].pi_arg) > 0)
00608                         seq_printf(m, "  - name: %s %s\n",
00609                                    infos[pol_idx].pi_name,
00610                                    infos[pol_idx].pi_arg);
00611                 else
00612                         seq_printf(m, "  - name: %s\n",
00613                                    infos[pol_idx].pi_name);
00614 
00615 
00616                 seq_printf(m, "    state: %s\n"
00617                            "    fallback: %s\n"
00618                            "    queued: %-20d\n"
00619                            "    active: %-20d\n\n",
00620                            nrs_state2str(infos[pol_idx].pi_state),
00621                            infos[pol_idx].pi_fallback ? "yes" : "no",
00622                            (int)infos[pol_idx].pi_req_queued,
00623                            (int)infos[pol_idx].pi_req_started);
00624         }
00625 
00626         if (!hp && nrs_svc_has_hp(svc)) {
00627                 memset(infos, 0, num_pols * sizeof(*infos));
00628 
00632                 hp = true;
00633                 goto again;
00634         }
00635 
00636 out:
00637         if (infos)
00638                 OBD_FREE(infos, num_pols * sizeof(*infos));
00639 
00640         mutex_unlock(&nrs_core.nrs_mutex);
00641 
00642         RETURN(rc);
00643 }
00644 
00645 
00646 #define LPROCFS_NRS_WR_MAX_ARG (1024)
00647 
00651 #define LPROCFS_NRS_WR_MAX_CMD  (NRS_POL_NAME_MAX + sizeof(" reg") - 1 \
00652                                  + LPROCFS_NRS_WR_MAX_ARG)
00653 
00661 static ssize_t
00662 ptlrpc_lprocfs_nrs_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
00663                              size_t count, loff_t *off)
00664 {
00665         struct seq_file                *m = file->private_data;
00666         struct ptlrpc_service          *svc = m->private;
00667         enum ptlrpc_nrs_queue_type      queue = PTLRPC_NRS_QUEUE_BOTH;
00668         char                           *cmd;
00669         char                           *cmd_copy = NULL;
00670         char                           *policy_name;
00671         char                           *queue_name;
00672         int                             rc = 0;
00673         ENTRY;
00674 
00675         if (count >= LPROCFS_NRS_WR_MAX_CMD)
00676                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00677 
00678         OBD_ALLOC(cmd, LPROCFS_NRS_WR_MAX_CMD);
00679         if (cmd == NULL)
00680                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00684         cmd_copy = cmd;
00685 
00686         if (copy_from_user(cmd, buffer, count))
00687                 GOTO(out, rc = -EFAULT);
00688 
00689         cmd[count] = '\0';
00690 
00691         policy_name = strsep(&cmd, " ");
00692 
00693         if (strlen(policy_name) > NRS_POL_NAME_MAX - 1)
00694                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00695 
00699         if (cmd == NULL)
00700                 goto default_queue;
00701 
00702         queue_name = strsep(&cmd, " ");
00707         if (strcmp(queue_name, "reg") == 0)
00708                 queue = PTLRPC_NRS_QUEUE_REG;
00709         else if (strcmp(queue_name, "hp") == 0)
00710                 queue = PTLRPC_NRS_QUEUE_HP;
00711         else {
00712                 if (cmd != NULL)
00713                         *(cmd - 1) = ' ';
00714                 cmd = queue_name;
00715         }
00716 
00717 default_queue:
00718 
00719         if (queue == PTLRPC_NRS_QUEUE_HP && !nrs_svc_has_hp(svc))
00720                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENODEV);
00721         else if (queue == PTLRPC_NRS_QUEUE_BOTH && !nrs_svc_has_hp(svc))
00722                 queue = PTLRPC_NRS_QUEUE_REG;
00723 
00728         mutex_lock(&nrs_core.nrs_mutex);
00729 
00730         rc = ptlrpc_nrs_policy_control(svc, queue, policy_name,
00731                                        PTLRPC_NRS_CTL_START,
00732                                        false, cmd);
00733 
00734         mutex_unlock(&nrs_core.nrs_mutex);
00735 out:
00736         if (cmd_copy)
00737                 OBD_FREE(cmd_copy, LPROCFS_NRS_WR_MAX_CMD);
00738 
00739         RETURN(rc < 0 ? rc : count);
00740 }
00741 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(ptlrpc_lprocfs_nrs);
00742 
00745 struct ptlrpc_srh_iterator {
00746         int                     srhi_idx;
00747         __u64                   srhi_seq;
00748         struct ptlrpc_request   *srhi_req;
00749 };
00750 
00751 static int
00752 ptlrpc_lprocfs_svc_req_history_seek(struct ptlrpc_service_part *svcpt,
00753                                     struct ptlrpc_srh_iterator *srhi,
00754                                     __u64 seq)
00755 {
00756         struct list_head        *e;
00757         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00758 
00759         if (srhi->srhi_req != NULL &&
00760             srhi->srhi_seq > svcpt->scp_hist_seq_culled &&
00761             srhi->srhi_seq <= seq) {
00762                 /* If srhi_req was set previously, hasn't been culled and
00763                  * we're searching for a seq on or after it (i.e. more
00764                  * recent), search from it onwards.
00765                  * Since the service history is LRU (i.e. culled reqs will
00766                  * be near the head), we shouldn't have to do long
00767                  * re-scans */
00768                 LASSERTF(srhi->srhi_seq == srhi->srhi_req->rq_history_seq,
00769                          "%s:%d: seek seq "LPU64", request seq "LPU64"\n",
00770                          svcpt->scp_service->srv_name, svcpt->scp_cpt,
00771                          srhi->srhi_seq, srhi->srhi_req->rq_history_seq);
00772                 LASSERTF(!list_empty(&svcpt->scp_hist_reqs),
00773                          "%s:%d: seek offset "LPU64", request seq "LPU64", "
00774                          "last culled "LPU64"\n",
00775                          svcpt->scp_service->srv_name, svcpt->scp_cpt,
00776                          seq, srhi->srhi_seq, svcpt->scp_hist_seq_culled);
00777                 e = &srhi->srhi_req->rq_history_list;
00778         } else {
00779                 /* search from start */
00780                 e = svcpt->scp_hist_reqs.next;
00781         }
00782 
00783         while (e != &svcpt->scp_hist_reqs) {
00784                 req = list_entry(e, struct ptlrpc_request, rq_history_list);
00785 
00786                 if (req->rq_history_seq >= seq) {
00787                         srhi->srhi_seq = req->rq_history_seq;
00788                         srhi->srhi_req = req;
00789                         return 0;
00790                 }
00791                 e = e->next;
00792         }
00793 
00794         return -ENOENT;
00795 }
00796 
00797 /*
00798  * ptlrpc history sequence is used as "position" of seq_file, in some case,
00799  * seq_read() will increase "position" to indicate reading the next
00800  * element, however, low bits of history sequence are reserved for CPT id
00801  * (check the details from comments before ptlrpc_req_add_history), which
00802  * means seq_read() might change CPT id of history sequence and never
00803  * finish reading of requests on a CPT. To make it work, we have to shift
00804  * CPT id to high bits and timestamp to low bits, so seq_read() will only
00805  * increase timestamp which can correctly indicate the next position.
00806  */
00807 
00808 /* convert seq_file pos to cpt */
00809 #define PTLRPC_REQ_POS2CPT(svc, pos)                    \
00810         ((svc)->srv_cpt_bits == 0 ? 0 :                 \
00811          (__u64)(pos) >> (64 - (svc)->srv_cpt_bits))
00812 
00813 /* make up seq_file pos from cpt */
00814 #define PTLRPC_REQ_CPT2POS(svc, cpt)                    \
00815         ((svc)->srv_cpt_bits == 0 ? 0 :                 \
00816          (cpt) << (64 - (svc)->srv_cpt_bits))
00817 
00818 /* convert sequence to position */
00819 #define PTLRPC_REQ_SEQ2POS(svc, seq)                    \
00820         ((svc)->srv_cpt_bits == 0 ? (seq) :             \
00821          ((seq) >> (svc)->srv_cpt_bits) |               \
00822          ((seq) << (64 - (svc)->srv_cpt_bits)))
00823 
00824 /* convert position to sequence */
00825 #define PTLRPC_REQ_POS2SEQ(svc, pos)                    \
00826         ((svc)->srv_cpt_bits == 0 ? (pos) :             \
00827          ((__u64)(pos) << (svc)->srv_cpt_bits) |        \
00828          ((__u64)(pos) >> (64 - (svc)->srv_cpt_bits)))
00829 
00830 static void *
00831 ptlrpc_lprocfs_svc_req_history_start(struct seq_file *s, loff_t *pos)
00832 {
00833         struct ptlrpc_service           *svc = s->private;
00834         struct ptlrpc_service_part      *svcpt;
00835         struct ptlrpc_srh_iterator      *srhi;
00836         unsigned int                    cpt;
00837         int                             rc;
00838         int                             i;
00839 
00840         if (sizeof(loff_t) != sizeof(__u64)) { /* can't support */
00841                 CWARN("Failed to read request history because size of loff_t "
00842                       "%d can't match size of u64\n", (int)sizeof(loff_t));
00843                 return NULL;
00844         }
00845 
00846         OBD_ALLOC(srhi, sizeof(*srhi));
00847         if (srhi == NULL)
00848                 return NULL;
00849 
00850         srhi->srhi_seq = 0;
00851         srhi->srhi_req = NULL;
00852 
00853         cpt = PTLRPC_REQ_POS2CPT(svc, *pos);
00854 
00855         ptlrpc_service_for_each_part(svcpt, i, svc) {
00856                 if (i < cpt) /* skip */
00857                         continue;
00858                 if (i > cpt) /* make up the lowest position for this CPT */
00859                         *pos = PTLRPC_REQ_CPT2POS(svc, i);
00860 
00861                 spin_lock(&svcpt->scp_lock);
00862                 rc = ptlrpc_lprocfs_svc_req_history_seek(svcpt, srhi,
00863                                 PTLRPC_REQ_POS2SEQ(svc, *pos));
00864                 spin_unlock(&svcpt->scp_lock);
00865                 if (rc == 0) {
00866                         *pos = PTLRPC_REQ_SEQ2POS(svc, srhi->srhi_seq);
00867                         srhi->srhi_idx = i;
00868                         return srhi;
00869                 }
00870         }
00871 
00872         OBD_FREE(srhi, sizeof(*srhi));
00873         return NULL;
00874 }
00875 
00876 static void
00877 ptlrpc_lprocfs_svc_req_history_stop(struct seq_file *s, void *iter)
00878 {
00879         struct ptlrpc_srh_iterator *srhi = iter;
00880 
00881         if (srhi != NULL)
00882                 OBD_FREE(srhi, sizeof(*srhi));
00883 }
00884 
00885 static void *
00886 ptlrpc_lprocfs_svc_req_history_next(struct seq_file *s,
00887                                     void *iter, loff_t *pos)
00888 {
00889         struct ptlrpc_service           *svc = s->private;
00890         struct ptlrpc_srh_iterator      *srhi = iter;
00891         struct ptlrpc_service_part      *svcpt;
00892         __u64                           seq;
00893         int                             rc;
00894         int                             i;
00895 
00896         for (i = srhi->srhi_idx; i < svc->srv_ncpts; i++) {
00897                 svcpt = svc->srv_parts[i];
00898 
00899                 if (i > srhi->srhi_idx) { /* reset iterator for a new CPT */
00900                         srhi->srhi_req = NULL;
00901                         seq = srhi->srhi_seq = 0;
00902                 } else { /* the next sequence */
00903                         seq = srhi->srhi_seq + (1 << svc->srv_cpt_bits);
00904                 }
00905 
00906                 spin_lock(&svcpt->scp_lock);
00907                 rc = ptlrpc_lprocfs_svc_req_history_seek(svcpt, srhi, seq);
00908                 spin_unlock(&svcpt->scp_lock);
00909                 if (rc == 0) {
00910                         *pos = PTLRPC_REQ_SEQ2POS(svc, srhi->srhi_seq);
00911                         srhi->srhi_idx = i;
00912                         return srhi;
00913                 }
00914         }
00915 
00916         OBD_FREE(srhi, sizeof(*srhi));
00917         return NULL;
00918 }
00919 
00920 /* common ost/mdt so_req_printer */
00921 void target_print_req(void *seq_file, struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00922 {
00923         /* Called holding srv_lock with irqs disabled.
00924          * Print specific req contents and a newline.
00925          * CAVEAT EMPTOR: check request message length before printing!!!
00926          * You might have received any old crap so you must be just as
00927          * careful here as the service's request parser!!! */
00928         struct seq_file *sf = seq_file;
00929 
00930         switch (req->rq_phase) {
00931         case RQ_PHASE_NEW:
00932                 /* still awaiting a service thread's attention, or rejected
00933                  * because the generic request message didn't unpack */
00934                 seq_printf(sf, "<not swabbed>\n");
00935                 break;
00936         case RQ_PHASE_INTERPRET:
00937                 /* being handled, so basic msg swabbed, and opc is valid
00938                  * but racing with mds_handle() */
00939         case RQ_PHASE_COMPLETE:
00940                 /* been handled by mds_handle() reply state possibly still
00941                  * volatile */
00942                 seq_printf(sf, "opc %d\n", lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg));
00943                 break;
00944         default:
00945                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "bad phase %d", req->rq_phase);
00946         }
00947 }
00948 EXPORT_SYMBOL(target_print_req);
00949 
00950 static int ptlrpc_lprocfs_svc_req_history_show(struct seq_file *s, void *iter)
00951 {
00952         struct ptlrpc_service           *svc = s->private;
00953         struct ptlrpc_srh_iterator      *srhi = iter;
00954         struct ptlrpc_service_part      *svcpt;
00955         struct ptlrpc_request           *req;
00956         int                             rc;
00957 
00958         LASSERT(srhi->srhi_idx < svc->srv_ncpts);
00959 
00960         svcpt = svc->srv_parts[srhi->srhi_idx];
00961 
00962         spin_lock(&svcpt->scp_lock);
00963 
00964         rc = ptlrpc_lprocfs_svc_req_history_seek(svcpt, srhi, srhi->srhi_seq);
00965 
00966         if (rc == 0) {
00967                 struct timespec arrival, sent, arrivaldiff;
00968                 char nidstr[LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE];
00969 
00970                 req = srhi->srhi_req;
00971 
00972                 libcfs_nid2str_r(req->rq_self, nidstr, sizeof(nidstr));
00973                 arrival.tv_sec = req->rq_arrival_time.tv_sec;
00974                 arrival.tv_nsec =
00975                         req->rq_arrival_time.tv_usec * NSEC_PER_USEC;
00976                 sent.tv_sec = req->rq_sent;
00977                 sent.tv_nsec = 0;
00978                 arrivaldiff = timespec_sub(sent, arrival);
00979 
00980                 /* Print common req fields.
00981                  * CAVEAT EMPTOR: we're racing with the service handler
00982                  * here.  The request could contain any old crap, so you
00983                  * must be just as careful as the service's request
00984                  * parser. Currently I only print stuff here I know is OK
00985                  * to look at coz it was set up in request_in_callback()!!! */
00986                 seq_printf(s, LPD64":%s:%s:x"LPU64":%d:%s:"
00987                            "%ld.%06ld:%ld.%06lds(%+ld.0s) ",
00988                            req->rq_history_seq, nidstr,
00989                            libcfs_id2str(req->rq_peer), req->rq_xid,
00990                            req->rq_reqlen, ptlrpc_rqphase2str(req),
00991                            req->rq_arrival_time.tv_sec,
00992                            req->rq_arrival_time.tv_usec,
00993                            arrivaldiff.tv_sec,
00994                            arrivaldiff.tv_nsec / NSEC_PER_USEC,
00995                            req->rq_sent - req->rq_deadline);
00996                 if (svc->srv_ops.so_req_printer == NULL)
00997                         seq_printf(s, "\n");
00998                 else
00999                         svc->srv_ops.so_req_printer(s, srhi->srhi_req);
01000         }
01001 
01002         spin_unlock(&svcpt->scp_lock);
01003         return rc;
01004 }
01005 
01006 static int
01007 ptlrpc_lprocfs_svc_req_history_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
01008 {
01009         static struct seq_operations sops = {
01010                 .start = ptlrpc_lprocfs_svc_req_history_start,
01011                 .stop  = ptlrpc_lprocfs_svc_req_history_stop,
01012                 .next  = ptlrpc_lprocfs_svc_req_history_next,
01013                 .show  = ptlrpc_lprocfs_svc_req_history_show,
01014         };
01015         struct seq_file *seqf;
01016         int             rc;
01017 
01018         rc = LPROCFS_ENTRY_CHECK(inode);
01019         if (rc < 0)
01020                 return rc;
01021 
01022         rc = seq_open(file, &sops);
01023         if (rc)
01024                 return rc;
01025 
01026         seqf = file->private_data;
01027         seqf->private = PDE_DATA(inode);
01028         return 0;
01029 }
01030 
01031 /* See also lprocfs_rd_timeouts */
01032 static int ptlrpc_lprocfs_timeouts_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *n)
01033 {
01034         struct ptlrpc_service           *svc = m->private;
01035         struct ptlrpc_service_part      *svcpt;
01036         struct dhms                     ts;
01037         time_t                          worstt;
01038         unsigned int                    cur;
01039         unsigned int                    worst;
01040         int                             i;
01041 
01042         if (AT_OFF) {
01043                 seq_printf(m, "adaptive timeouts off, using obd_timeout %u\n",
01044                            obd_timeout);
01045                 return 0;
01046         }
01047 
01048         ptlrpc_service_for_each_part(svcpt, i, svc) {
01049                 cur     = at_get(&svcpt->scp_at_estimate);
01050                 worst   = svcpt->scp_at_estimate.at_worst_ever;
01051                 worstt  = svcpt->scp_at_estimate.at_worst_time;
01052                 s2dhms(&ts, cfs_time_current_sec() - worstt);
01053 
01054                 seq_printf(m, "%10s : cur %3u  worst %3u (at %ld, "
01055                            DHMS_FMT" ago) ", "service",
01056                            cur, worst, worstt, DHMS_VARS(&ts));
01057 
01058                 lprocfs_at_hist_helper(m, &svcpt->scp_at_estimate);
01059         }
01060 
01061         return 0;
01062 }
01063 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RO(ptlrpc_lprocfs_timeouts);
01064 
01065 static int ptlrpc_lprocfs_hp_ratio_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
01066 {
01067         struct ptlrpc_service *svc = m->private;
01068         seq_printf(m, "%d\n", svc->srv_hpreq_ratio);
01069         return 0;
01070 }
01071 
01072 static ssize_t
01073 ptlrpc_lprocfs_hp_ratio_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
01074                                   size_t count, loff_t *off)
01075 {
01076         struct seq_file *m = file->private_data;
01077         struct ptlrpc_service *svc = m->private;
01078         int rc;
01079         __s64 val;
01080 
01081         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
01082         if (rc < 0)
01083                 return rc;
01084 
01085         if (val < 0 || val > INT_MAX)
01086                 return -ERANGE;
01087 
01088         spin_lock(&svc->srv_lock);
01089         svc->srv_hpreq_ratio = val;
01090         spin_unlock(&svc->srv_lock);
01091 
01092         return count;
01093 }
01094 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(ptlrpc_lprocfs_hp_ratio);
01095 
01096 void ptlrpc_lprocfs_register_service(struct proc_dir_entry *entry,
01097                                      struct ptlrpc_service *svc)
01098 {
01099         struct lprocfs_vars lproc_vars[] = {
01100                 { .name = "high_priority_ratio",
01101                   .fops = &ptlrpc_lprocfs_hp_ratio_fops,
01102                   .data = svc },
01103                 { .name = "req_buffer_history_len",
01104                   .fops = &ptlrpc_lprocfs_req_history_len_fops,
01105                   .data = svc },
01106                 { .name = "req_buffer_history_max",
01107                   .fops = &ptlrpc_lprocfs_req_history_max_fops,
01108                   .data = svc },
01109                 { .name = "threads_min",
01110                   .fops = &ptlrpc_lprocfs_threads_min_fops,
01111                   .data = svc },
01112                 { .name = "threads_max",
01113                   .fops = &ptlrpc_lprocfs_threads_max_fops,
01114                   .data = svc },
01115                 { .name = "threads_started",
01116                   .fops = &ptlrpc_lprocfs_threads_started_fops,
01117                   .data = svc },
01118                 { .name = "timeouts",
01119                   .fops = &ptlrpc_lprocfs_timeouts_fops,
01120                   .data = svc },
01121                 { .name = "nrs_policies",
01122                   .fops = &ptlrpc_lprocfs_nrs_fops,
01123                   .data = svc },
01124                 { NULL }
01125         };
01126         static struct file_operations req_history_fops = {
01127                 .owner       = THIS_MODULE,
01128                 .open        = ptlrpc_lprocfs_svc_req_history_open,
01129                 .read        = seq_read,
01130                 .llseek      = seq_lseek,
01131                 .release     = lprocfs_seq_release,
01132         };
01133 
01134         int rc;
01135 
01136         ptlrpc_lprocfs_register(entry, svc->srv_name,
01137                                 "stats", &svc->srv_procroot,
01138                                 &svc->srv_stats);
01139         if (svc->srv_procroot == NULL)
01140                 return;
01141 
01142         lprocfs_add_vars(svc->srv_procroot, lproc_vars, NULL);
01143 
01144         rc = lprocfs_seq_create(svc->srv_procroot, "req_history",
01145                                 0400, &req_history_fops, svc);
01146         if (rc)
01147                 CWARN("Error adding the req_history file\n");
01148 }
01149 
01150 void ptlrpc_lprocfs_register_obd(struct obd_device *obddev)
01151 {
01152         ptlrpc_lprocfs_register(obddev->obd_proc_entry, NULL, "stats",
01153                                 &obddev->obd_svc_procroot,
01154                                 &obddev->obd_svc_stats);
01155 }
01156 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_lprocfs_register_obd);
01157 
01158 void ptlrpc_lprocfs_rpc_sent(struct ptlrpc_request *req, long amount)
01159 {
01160         struct lprocfs_stats *svc_stats;
01161         __u32 op = lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg);
01162         int opc = opcode_offset(op);
01163 
01164         svc_stats = req->rq_import->imp_obd->obd_svc_stats;
01165         if (svc_stats == NULL || opc <= 0)
01166                 return;
01167         LASSERT(opc < LUSTRE_MAX_OPCODES);
01168         if (!(op == LDLM_ENQUEUE || op == MDS_REINT))
01169                 lprocfs_counter_add(svc_stats, opc + EXTRA_MAX_OPCODES, amount);
01170 }
01171 
01172 void ptlrpc_lprocfs_brw(struct ptlrpc_request *req, int bytes)
01173 {
01174         struct lprocfs_stats *svc_stats;
01175         int idx;
01176 
01177         if (!req->rq_import)
01178                 return;
01179         svc_stats = req->rq_import->imp_obd->obd_svc_stats;
01180         if (!svc_stats)
01181                 return;
01182         idx = lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg);
01183         switch (idx) {
01184         case OST_READ:
01185                 idx = BRW_READ_BYTES + PTLRPC_LAST_CNTR;
01186                 break;
01187         case OST_WRITE:
01188                 idx = BRW_WRITE_BYTES + PTLRPC_LAST_CNTR;
01189                 break;
01190         default:
01191                 LASSERTF(0, "unsupported opcode %u\n", idx);
01192                 break;
01193         }
01194 
01195         lprocfs_counter_add(svc_stats, idx, bytes);
01196 }
01197 
01198 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_lprocfs_brw);
01199 
01200 void ptlrpc_lprocfs_unregister_service(struct ptlrpc_service *svc)
01201 {
01202         if (svc->srv_procroot != NULL)
01203                 lprocfs_remove(&svc->srv_procroot);
01204 
01205         if (svc->srv_stats)
01206                 lprocfs_free_stats(&svc->srv_stats);
01207 }
01208 
01209 void ptlrpc_lprocfs_unregister_obd(struct obd_device *obd)
01210 {
01211         if (obd->obd_svc_procroot)
01212                 lprocfs_remove(&obd->obd_svc_procroot);
01213 
01214         if (obd->obd_svc_stats)
01215                 lprocfs_free_stats(&obd->obd_svc_stats);
01216 }
01217 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_lprocfs_unregister_obd);
01218 
01219 ssize_t
01220 lprocfs_ping_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
01221                        size_t count, loff_t *off)
01222 {
01223         struct seq_file         *m = file->private_data;
01224         struct obd_device       *obd = m->private;
01225         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
01226         int                     rc;
01227         ENTRY;
01228 
01229         LPROCFS_CLIMP_CHECK(obd);
01230         req = ptlrpc_prep_ping(obd->u.cli.cl_import);
01231         LPROCFS_CLIMP_EXIT(obd);
01232         if (req == NULL)
01233                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01234 
01235         req->rq_send_state = LUSTRE_IMP_FULL;
01236 
01237         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01238 
01239         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01240         if (rc >= 0)
01241                 RETURN(count);
01242         RETURN(rc);
01243 }
01244 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_ping_seq_write);
01245 
01246 /* Write the connection UUID to this file to attempt to connect to that node.
01247  * The connection UUID is a node's primary NID. For example,
01248  * "echo connection=192.168.0.1@tcp0::instance > .../import".
01249  */
01250 ssize_t
01251 lprocfs_import_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
01252                          size_t count, loff_t *off)
01253 {
01254         struct seq_file   *m    = file->private_data;
01255         struct obd_device *obd  = m->private;
01256         struct obd_import *imp  = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
01257         char *kbuf = NULL;
01258         char *uuid;
01259         char *ptr;
01260         int do_reconn = 1;
01261         const char prefix[] = "connection=";
01262         const int prefix_len = sizeof(prefix) - 1;
01263 
01264         if (count > PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - 1 || count <= prefix_len)
01265                 return -EINVAL;
01266 
01267         OBD_ALLOC(kbuf, count + 1);
01268         if (kbuf == NULL)
01269                 return -ENOMEM;
01270 
01271         if (copy_from_user(kbuf, buffer, count))
01272                 GOTO(out, count = -EFAULT);
01273 
01274         kbuf[count] = 0;
01275 
01276         /* only support connection=uuid::instance now */
01277         if (strncmp(prefix, kbuf, prefix_len) != 0)
01278                 GOTO(out, count = -EINVAL);
01279 
01280         uuid = kbuf + prefix_len;
01281         ptr = strstr(uuid, "::");
01282         if (ptr) {
01283                 __u32 inst;
01284                 char *endptr;
01285 
01286                 *ptr = 0;
01287                 do_reconn = 0;
01288                 ptr += 2; /* Skip :: */
01289                 inst = simple_strtol(ptr, &endptr, 10);
01290                 if (*endptr) {
01291                         CERROR("config: wrong instance # %s\n", ptr);
01292                 } else if (inst != imp->imp_connect_data.ocd_instance) {
01293                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "IR: %s is connecting to an obsoleted "
01294                                "target(%u/%u), reconnecting...\n",
01295                                imp->imp_obd->obd_name,
01296                                imp->imp_connect_data.ocd_instance, inst);
01297                         do_reconn = 1;
01298                 } else {
01299                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "IR: %s has already been connecting to "
01300                                "new target(%u)\n",
01301                                imp->imp_obd->obd_name, inst);
01302                 }
01303         }
01304 
01305         if (do_reconn)
01306                 ptlrpc_recover_import(imp, uuid, 1);
01307 
01308 out:
01309         OBD_FREE(kbuf, count + 1);
01310         return count;
01311 }
01312 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_import_seq_write);
01313 
01314 int lprocfs_pinger_recov_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *n)
01315 {
01316         struct obd_device *obd = m->private;
01317         struct obd_import *imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
01318 
01319         LPROCFS_CLIMP_CHECK(obd);
01320         seq_printf(m, "%d\n", !imp->imp_no_pinger_recover);
01321         LPROCFS_CLIMP_EXIT(obd);
01322         return 0;
01323 }
01324 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_pinger_recov_seq_show);
01325 
01326 ssize_t
01327 lprocfs_pinger_recov_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
01328                                size_t count, loff_t *off)
01329 {
01330         struct seq_file *m = file->private_data;
01331         struct obd_device *obd = m->private;
01332         struct client_obd *cli = &obd->u.cli;
01333         struct obd_import *imp = cli->cl_import;
01334         int rc;
01335         __s64 val;
01336 
01337         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
01338         if (rc < 0)
01339                 return rc;
01340 
01341         if (val != 0 && val != 1)
01342                 return -ERANGE;
01343 
01344         LPROCFS_CLIMP_CHECK(obd);
01345         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
01346         imp->imp_no_pinger_recover = !val;
01347         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
01348         LPROCFS_CLIMP_EXIT(obd);
01349         return count;
01350 }
01351 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lprocfs_pinger_recov_seq_write);
01352 
01353 #endif /* CONFIG_PROC_FS */
